### Issue URL (Ads) [https://www.hulu.com/watch/98213d96-0386-4a5c-af35-21e8a6ec217b](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.hulu.com%2Fwatch%2F98213d96-0386-4a5c-af35-21e8a6ec217b) ### Comment > Although I have AdGuard for Safari installed, and it's consistently prevented ads from popping up before, it's no longer working. I use our family computer so I'm not sure if somebody changed something thats affected it, but I deleted and reinstalled it, and only checked the starting filters, so I don't know if this really isn't possible to prevent anymore or if I'm missing something. comment.body:
Not reproduced on my end.
Try to leave only AdGuard filters, update them (wait almost one minute there), clear browser data, restart it, open the site.
If that doesn't work, you should re-enable the content blockers in Safari settings (wait about the same time as when you update the filters).

issue.title: www.mynet.com

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# Sorry. The website is infected by AdShield, Inc.

Unfortunately, It is complicated to resolve with a regular adblock rule because the website is being protected by service of Ad-Shield that is an anti-adblock company.

## Userscript Installation
Please block Ad-Shield advertisement by installing [tinyShield userscript](https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield).
Please check its installation guideline written in English by visiting [this URL](https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield/blob/main/README.md).

If you can understand Korean language, please refer https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield/blob/main/README.ko.md.

## Still Have a Problem?
An issue is occurred when the userscript is applied, please report to [this issue tracker](https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield/issues).

AdGuard Browser Extension ### AdGuard version 4.4.49 ### What type of problem have you encountered? Website or app doesn't work properly, AdGuard gets detected on a website ### Which browser(s) do you use? Firefox ### Which device do you use? Desktop ### Where is the problem encountered? transparentnevada.com ### Ad Blocking AdGuard Base filter ### Privacy _No response_ ### Social Widgets _No response_ ### Annoyances _No response_ ### Security _No response_ ### Other _No response_ ### DNS filters _No response_ ### Language-specific _No response_ ### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled? _No response_ ### Add your comment and screenshots 1. This filter triggers Adblock detection, preventing access to the website. It appears that exempting this filter resolves the issue, so I am reporting it. ``` 07c225f3.online,content-loader.com,css-load.com,html-load.com,img-load.com#$?#body:not(:has(script:contains(style.getPropertyValue))) { filter: opacity(0) !important; pointer-events: none !important; } ``` 2. Screenshots
Screenshot 1:
Screenshot 2: Disable filter
### Privacy - [x] I agree to follow this condition

fix weloma - viewer not loaded; also moved the blocking rule to correct file

issue.title: Fix #200123 playhop.com
issue.body:
Issue: https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/200123

Are there any issues if we use this rule:

```adb
||yastatic.net/partner-code-bundles/$domain=playhop.com
```

?

comment.body:
Missed leftovers

<details>
<summary>Details</summary>

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/31fdaf8e-bae5-4f4b-b0b7-658d9fb37380)


</details>

And Yandex common ad script, initial for `yastatic.net/partner-code-bundles/` (different URL, than used on RU sites):
```adblock
||yandex.com/ads/system/context.js
```

CC: @ryanbr

You can manually disable these rules and add uBlock filters (https://raw.githubusercontent.com/uBlockOrigin/uAssetsCDN/refs/heads/main/filters/filters.txt), then the anti adblock script won't be triggered.

pull_request.title: Fix #200470
pull_request.body: # Creating the pull request > Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\ > If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\ > It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\ > Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it ## Prerequisites ### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms - [x] This is not an ad/bug report; - [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project; - [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes; - [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure. ## What problem does the pull request fix? ### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section - [ ] Missed ads or ad leftovers; - [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly; - [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website; - [ ] Missed analytics or tracker; - [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc; - [x] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc; - [ ] Filters maintenance. ## What issue is being fixed? - Resolves #200470 ### Add your comment and screenshots #### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located 1. Your comment I have fixed the non-skippable tutorial, but wasn't able to resolve the two pop-ups afterwards. The non-skippable tutorial is marked as clear in the local storage. (See in screenshot) Setting the local storage value to completed fixed the problem. 2. Screenshots Before: After: ### Terms - [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 10 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).
